0.12.x.message:
Hi folks, welcome to the new 0.12 series of Moss.

This versions updates to the latest Holochain, so you will have to re-create any groups you have and copy over your data.

This version includes a number feature enhancements and stability improvements to both Moss and many of the Tools.

### Moss improvements:
- Updated to run on the latest stable release of Holochain: 0.3.1. This means Moss uses much less CPU, syncronizes more quickly, and is more stable.
- Adds the ability to set a group description for the group Home page. Note that you can use WAL urls (copy them from the share link in the pocket) in the markdown and they work!
- Adds stewarded groups, where the ability to edit group description, profile, and the installed tool set is limited to stewards. Some tools may also restrict certain functionality to group stewards.
- An updated feedback system which makes it easier for us to respond to individual feedback items, and for you to keep track of our responses.
- Updates to the tool library: Adds developer collectives an displays that info when browsing the library.
- And many usability improvements based on feedback we received.

### Tool Improvements and Fixes

- **Kando:**
- Improvements to the feed
- Creator of a board can now delete the board
- **Notebooks:**
- Improved, list-based, main view
- Improved version UI
- **Converge:**
- Adds indications of new activity
- Adds ability to mark deliberations complete
- **Data-tub:**
- Adds Views
- Adds linkable rows and columns
- **ZipZap:**
- Conversation streams can now be used as Assets.
- Stream auto-scrolls
- **Vines:**
- Direct messages
- **Presence:**
- In case that Presence is run in a stewarded group, only group stewards can create shared rooms
- **Emergence:**
- Now honors group stewards from Weave as the

On May 30th at 9 am EST (3 pm CET) we will host a "Play-date" where we will explore using the Weave by focusing on the Gamez a tool that allows groups to create arbitrary types of games.

 As we play, we can talk about what type of games we can make and use the collaborative documents, kanban and chat functionalities to jam on the ideas. We think this will be a fun way for us to get to play with the Weave that will spark creative connection. 

 Join the [open Weavers group](https://lightningrodlabs.org/we?we://group/d86f59b5-def4-4fbb-961e-be487d87df74) ahead of time so your node has time to syncronize. 

 The event will be live on Zoom at [this link](https://us06web.zoom.us/j/82751356671?pwd=hC3DTPti3aB0IIMuVLDnQlLB4LZNu8.1)
Hi Weavers! Thanks for joining us at the first Weave Community Gathering!  The next one will be held on June 15th.  Watch this space for links and time.

Moss version 0.11.12 contains mainly invisible changes to improve performance and adds more functionality to the debugging panel (double-click on the version number in the bottom left to open the debugging panel).

Moss versions 0.11.9 and 0.11.10 contain a bug that prevents automatic updates from succeeding on macOS and Windows. To resolve the issue, manually download and install the latest version of Moss from https://theweave.social/moss
